one_reviews_text: i think this game is SOOO FUN!i DO recommend

This game had been sitting in my library for a few months, so I decided to play through it, and it's pretty well made. it's pretty charming, I love the artstyle, and while there really isn't too much interaction here, there's just enough to where you don't feel like you're just sitting there the whole time. I was gonna give this game I good recommendation, but then I realized that this game is actually $9. Which is baffling because I remember getting this game for free. For an experience that's like 40 minutes long, $9 is a Godawful price, I feel even $5 dollars would still be too much for this. This game is charming, but it's far from being worth it's price

review_title: Should NOT be in the category of puzzles
one_reviews_text:
Yes the graphics are cool and surreal, the story is cute, but there were only 2 interactive parts that lasted maybe 15 seconds. The rest was just sitting there watching a story. 
Granted, it’s cool but it’s not a puzzle or game AT ALL. 
Luckily some got this for free, but I wouldn’t pay the 10 bucks like I did. Not worth just a cartoon story no matter how good the graphics are in this 30 minute long tale. Frustrating.  
Hard pass.
Constantly crashes on brand new Quest 2 (native Quest version). Can't get through it. Seems like it could be neat though.

This has Blown. My. Mind. The levels of animation, design and - particularly -interaction far exceed anything else I've found in Oculus. No idea what the story was an analogy for, but who cares?!! Really clever stuff. Beautiful.

There is a lot I can say but I just want to summarize it with one word: WOW.

I am absolutely not expecting a free experience to be so overwhelming.. So much work and thoughts put into it. I would gladly pay $9.99 or more for it. In fact, why don't you go ahead and charge it to my account. Excellent job guys, I had goose bumps at the end and even a hint of tears, and I gave you a standing ovation.. Well deserved.. Again, WOW...
POGGERS  RUN AWAY

review_title: I've played all the top VR games...
one_reviews_text: And this one stands alone as one of my favorites. Well worth the price. Thank you for creating this.

Beautiful interpretation of Niel Gaiman's book! And major props to the animators for managing to create a style that resembles Dave McKean's illustrations in motion.

This one is a real gem!
Hats off to the creators, it was worth the wait! Hope to see more from them ^-^
I got this thinking it would be scary but it was actually quite cute and fun. If you like games where its a story but you still get to interact this is the perfect game.

I thought a sympathetic story about a little girl wouldn't be *that* scary even if it was tagged as horror. I was wrong. I mean, it was sympathetic, and it has beautiful art and a good message, but the horror was way too much for me. I can never play this again.

Even though the ending showed that everything turned out ok and the scary things could be dealt with — even made to be funny and sweet — the midpoint of the story was an intense experience of being utterly overwhelmed by raw, inhuman evil.

review_title: I can't explain how good this is!
one_reviews_text: AMAZING!!!!GAME!!!!!

Wolves in the Walls is a very short but amazing experience, and is a perfect example of the main thing VR excels at; Immersion and interactive storytelling!

It's completely free, so there's really no reason not to try it unless you're just not interested. It's only about 35 minutes long, and it's really fun. I'd highly recommend anyone with a VR headset to give this a go! It's absolutely wonderful!

This was a totally unexpected delight!  A Neil Gaiman story that truly came to life.  The characters were so endearing and the story so well done I'm having everyone that is around watch it.  

I'm looking forward to more of these.
Enjoyed it, well done!
this is one of the best free VR games I have ever played

review_title: Fantastic! Neil Gaiman at his best
one_reviews_text: A fantasic experience and a great example of VR storytelling. I experienced this after watching Neil Gaiman's Masterclass. This is one of those unexpected VR gems. Great work by the devs bringing it to life. Recommended for the young ones and the young at  heart.
Amazing experience.

A wonderful experience that truly captures how it feels to be on the other side of an imaginary friendship, with a beautifully crafted little world that contains both lurking terrors and curious mysteries, as well as an atmosphere of love and heart.

The experience only lasts about 45 mins to an hour, and my only complaint is that I couldn't stay for much, much longer. Please keep content like this coming!

Wow. This is my new go to for showing people vr. Simply incredible. Amazing graphics, interesting story, and fun interactions all come together nicely. Easily the best free experiance ive tried. I proboably would have bought this for 10$ and still been happy with my purchace. Really good job. Cant wait to see more from these guys.

review_title: One of the best VR Cinematic Experiences
one_reviews_text:
Well, I've just finished it and I'm all tears... If you like action games, etc. do not download it. If you like to experiencie a 40 min. interactive animation movie were you are one of the characters, interacting with this cute little girl, surrounded by  incredible well crafted scenarios, characters and vfx, with a heart braking exquisite soundtrack that makes you cry for moments... Well, then this is for you! 

Now it's one of my top 5 VR experiences togheter with Vader Immortal, First Contact, etc. 

It's not just about all that I said, but about everything mixed in an incredible experience... Just like in a great movie, it's not enough to have well made things: All those things must be created because you need them to build the story, and not the opposite (making a story because you can do great scenaries, fx, etc.)... 

Resuming: This is the way I think a really good VR interactive movie must be.

I loaded up this game and i expected some kind of silly childish thing but this, it blew me away. The visuals are amazing, the story is excellent and a perfect game to new people comming into vr. Becuase this shows off everything VR and more.

This is the best interactive story I've played, just try it, you won't regret it. Free VR games of this quality is hard to come by. The storytelling, graphics and interactions are great, you really feel included in this adventure which is tons of fun. This game made me feel like a kid in the most wonderful and nostalgic way! Such a cute and adorable adventure.

This game is, by far, one of the best vr games I have played. It's really interactive and it has such a driven story which makes you want to continue. Honestly, I'd pay for this if I had to. It's kind of a shame it was free, since it was such a good game. Absolutely perfect.
it was amazing

The game is pretty fun and interesting and I would play it again anytime. My only problem is the short storyline. I wish there was more to the story and more drawing with the chalk. The chalk, by far, is the best in my opinion. But I would like to have more adventures with Lucy because she is a very fun character to interact with. I would recomened a longer storyline and more adventures. 
THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR READING MY REVEIW!  :D

While many games are fun, this is truly an 'experience' like no other: an interactive movie that you makes you feel like you are truly part of, an emotional journey connecting with a little girl and her dreams and fears, a delightful story that unfolds with such artistic inventiveness and prowess that every scene leaves you in awe. A must have!
This was an unforgettable experience. Let yourself experience this with no interruptions as soon as you possibly can.
Interesting plot, awesome graphics and art style, and I had no problems with the game!

I have been using my rift for some time  now and tried many different experiences. I truly love vr and have exposed myself to a wide variety of content. I hope that helps give a certain weight when I say that this is something special.

Many of the better titles I have tried translated very well to VR, but often that's kinda the issue. They Translate. Many just use the VR platform as a way to get that extra bit of immersion out of a story that could be told just fine on a screen. They may use full 360, or give you little set pieces to play with the motion controls, but here in  Wolves In the Walls VR is truly leveraged, not translated. 

Wolves in the Walls does a fantastic job of drawing your eyes to where you should be looking when necessary, but also gives you space to look around the world in many spots. More than anything, the world design is absolutely increadible, flipping from the imaginative mind's eye of Lucy to a more grounded world view so seamlesly it's increadible. 

This is probably the most polished, well thought out VR specific experience I have found so far. After years of fantasitc VR content, this is the first that truly brought back the feeling I had when I first put on my headset. Bravo.
Honestly this title alone is worth buying a Rift for.  It is so well thought out and the immersion is unreal.  Great job!
What a wonderful experience. Almost brought tears to my eyes at the end. Brilliant work.
Amazing so real I wish there was more Vr experiences like this one.
Really incredible art, music and fun interactions. Had a magical feeling to it, absolutely loved it :)

This is honestly one of the best experiences I've had in VR.  It's an interactive story that genuinely makes you feel like you became friends with this little girl.  This is what VR is all about.  

Super well done, and super tailored to VR and full of details.

I can't recommend this enough.  I hope more content is created like this.  I'd love to see a sequal or 8
Incredible quality for something that's free. Definitely worth checking out.

Hello! Deaf gamer here. I need subtitles. Please?

The best subtitle systems are the "Republque VR"-style gentle floats, or the "Red Matter"-style wrist mounted pipboy equivalent.

I wasted money on this game because I didn't know it did not have subtitles.  The Oculus Store does not inform whether a game has subtitles or not.

Oculus Store gets docked 1 star because it does not have a "Subtitles: Yes/No" field like SteamVR does. I heard through a friend that some group at Gallaudet University (deaf university) is considering a lawsuit to Oculus to humbly request Oculus to make a minor change to Oculus Store (a Subtitles Yes/No checkbox) to get them to at least tell deaf gamers whether a VR game has subtitles or not.

review_title: Ended Up Talking to the Game as I Played
one_reviews_text:
Best free game I have played in vr next to PokerstarsVR. 

What an enjoyable experiance. What a sence of joy I gained once the girl granted me perfecty sculpted hands.  It's a game, Inside a game. Hit about every emotion on the feelings scale.

review_title: Wow, I Should've Played This Sooner!
one_reviews_text: I had this game installed on my PC for IDK how long before I played it for the first time today. Over a year maybe? But this is bay far one of the best expereinces I've had in VR. And I've had my Oculus for many years now. Take a seat in a swivel chair or stand for about 30-45min and enjoy. I'll definitely add this to my Demo collection to friends/family at parties/get togethers.
Great story Great interaction Great gameplay Great visiuals will be my go to reference during convos 10/10 loved it!

When I downloaded WitW, it ended with the wolves taking over. It felt like i had been cut short. However, the new ending is by far one of the greatest I've seen in VR yet. Lucy was relatable, admirable, and, somehow, one of my friends. Fully immersive, yet simplistic in design, this title threw me into a world i wasnt ready to experience, and gave me an ending i never wanted to come. I desperately hope for more content, whether its more to this story, or another. I look forward to future releases, and the wolves will always hold a special place in my heart

I have to say, the story wasnt the sort of thing I could have even made it to the end of on a TV, but even so, this is undeniably an incredibly beautiful presentation and in VR it's a real eye opener to the possibilities. 
I really think this proves beyond doubt that watching 2D TV and movies will one day be a thing of the past. Immersion will only get better and this has to be seen to be understood. 
I've watched animated movies in VR and been impressed, but this is a like a hybrid movie/game. A genuine interactive movie the like of which I didnt think would be possible yet.
Worth paying for, so for free, no brainer as they say.

The story, grapics, music and just overall design of the game was fantastic.
Highly recommend ;)

This is probably one of my favorite short films in VR that I have tried. The interaction and story is amazing. I haven't experienced something like this before. At the end of the film I got kinda sad and wanted to know more and see more. I was striked by the ending, but if it was a different ending I don't think I would have loved it as much. This story adds a mystery and something that gets your heart pumping. I recommend this to anyone who loves animated films/just films. I will be showing this to everyone I know. Thank you very much for making this amazing vr experience.

UPDATE: I AM SOOO THANKFUL! This is what I wanted and MORE! I truly feel as though I am friends with Lucy and felt like it was an adventure with my friend. The gameplay and mystery felt very immersive and I was very happy with the ending. PLEASE make more animations! we need this type of stuff in VR and we rarely get them so I TRULY THANK YOU FOR THAT!! It was crazy to see how much people worked on this masterpiece I can't thank you enough for this wonderful Movie/Game/Animation. Again I'm glad with the outcome and will show this to my friends and family.

Loved it! An absolute treat. I'm relatively new to VR and without doubt this is one of the most enjoyable experiences I've had yet. Beautiful, engaging, totally immersive and free to boot, sure ya can't go wrong. If you are considering trying this, definitely do, you will not be disappointed. I certainly wasn't.

review_title: Just one of the best VR Experiences Ever
one_reviews_text: What a flipping great time to be alive! This is VR. I can't believe this is free. I love how they directed your vision. This was so emotional and brilliantly conceived. Bravo! Seriously, amazing work.
We need more of this!

This is perfect for beginners and very kid firendly. You can definitely see the passion the devs behind this project had in everything your see. The art style is pretty adorable too. This should be one of the first things you download after getting VR and you can use it to show off how cool VR stuffies can be :)

review_title: i love this  game. I ts beautiful
one_reviews_text: i love this  game. I ts beautiful
mixing a magical story and a fantastic experience all in one. Highly recommend
It is such a great experience to have for the oculus, simply incredible. Well done, from the story to the characters. We need more of this quiality of work.
... dark in places, and short. I enjoyed myself thoroughly!

Theres few VR games or experiences that really wow me like this. of course the gameplay is minimal, but its not the focus, the focus is the developers handcrafting a story that you are a part of, and the visual effects and odditys astound.
Rarely have i seen so many new and innovative techniques used all at once. there are times where you put your ear to the wall with a jar to listen, other times you play a vr game in a vr game, and then some visual and virtual space tricks (for instance getting on the floor and looking down through a hatch at a wolf playing the violin in a comical way) that are done flawlessly, wrapped in a story thats heartfelt and blooming with artistry.

i loved this, and i would love to see more movie type vr experiences that put the player in the characters shoes. considering its free, thats all the more reason to try it .you will love it too.

First of all it's free which is amazing. I'd pay good money for this experience. It's incredibly immersive, looks great. The story is interesting and fun. Overall a must experience for people of all ages!

review_title: one the of the best in my library
one_reviews_text: my daughters used to play this one 3-4 times a day. loved it. Hope more of this type in the future

When I first glanced at this game I thought It would have been too childish to play for me, since I come from high-FPS esports gaming. 
I’ve never been so wrong. 

Wolves in the walls is a beautiful experience polished by developers like nothing I’ve played before. You don’t need to shoot, punch or slice enemies here (uhm well, not for the whole time). You will help someone who relies on you in such an intimate way that has left me breathless. Wonderfully drawn environments flow around you as you hold Lucy’s hand, bringing you through the relationships inside a busy family.
Dialogues, voices and musics do create an awesome immersion.
Light is superbly managed creating something unique which stands between oneiric and real.
I completely lost the perception of time, rushing about 1:15h of VR without any interruption.
Oh, and it’s free. 

This is a true gem out of an endless library of reality simulators. I’m looking forward to see more games like this one. Games which leave you with something to think of, and appreciate both the effort of developers and the luxury of letting yourself be amazed of something different from war, action, enemies to fight.
This is about imagination, empathy, friendship. 
And those are the values I would like kids to be taught, not only by parents, but also from games.
A perfect experience, but it could've been a bit longer.

My expectations where blown away with this game, i love it!

i think that this is the most immersive vr game i have played so far. I have been playing vr for many years and have tried countless games, but this takes the cake!
This game will be perfect for newcommers to vr, it'll open up peoples minds to the endless possibilities of vr.

Keep up the amazing work! 
Yours sincerly, Gamerguy.

One of the best VR experiences I've ever had! Cute, scary and smart. I would easily have payed for this. 

I'm really hoping for more!

review_title: Outstanding Title for Any VR Collection
one_reviews_text: An absolutely exceptional VR experience for almost all ages.  While it does has some mild dark and spooky moments, this experience is highly immersive, interactive with a strong moral conclusion.  It does have a few room scale requirements and the experience has limited reply value but you are effectively interacting in an animated short story movie with your new friend Lucy.  I would highly recommend this title for any VR collection and to share with family and friends.

The art style is very appealing, story's buildup is very nice, and the climax of the first half is REALLY intense.
However, it's kinda downhill from there. Everything is solved embarassingly easily and without much suspense or interest. 
As of now, I'd give it 2.5 if I could. Tons of interesting ideas with cool visuals are introduced, and nothing is done with them in the end. 
In my opinion, this is an example of cramming too many good ideas together. If none of them get any focus, all of them feel wasted.

Top notch in every way, Wolves in the Walls is a great game for all ages, if a bit spooky for the little ones.  The immersion is so good.  Even though the experience is on rails, I felt like I really was important.  This is a must-play adventure and one of the best experiences I have had in VR.  And it's free.

That was an amazing experience. I really enjoyed how I can interact with objects even though it is more of a short story. I was freaked out of the wolves and when Lucy said "you look", I was genuinly scared as I thought something was going to jump out. Really great app and it is free too!

This might be my favorite VR experience ever. I never expected such a high level of polish, not only does this have a well crafted story and world, the acting and interactions bring this to a whole new level. For example, Henry is a great VR mini story but I felt much more present in Lucy's home than Henry's home because of the way this mixes passive storytelling with player input. This experience makes me wonder about the amazing future of this technology. I will definitely be using this to showcase the magic of VR to friends and family in the future, thank you for creating this.
I have had this for some time and just now played it.  Beautiful and moving. Among the best VR experiences, and it was FREE?

the fact that there is a free VR game that I prever much over some paied games is amazing. I also have never played a game like this and it was so much fun. I also love the little surprice you get at the end.

review_title: What it's like to be imaginary.
one_reviews_text: I really enjoy animated stories in VR, just because of the feeling you are part of the story. This one has an interesting art style to it, almost like it is right out of a children's book. The flow between scenes gives you that perception of imagination. The minor interactions make you feel even more like her imaginary friend. I would love to see more like this.

review_title: A must have! Simply amazing experience.
one_reviews_text: This has to be one of the best VR experiences I have ever had. It's both emotional and intriguing. I can only recomend this. I hope we see more from this developer soon!

I didnt have high hopes for this at all I was already sat there thinking it would be rubbbish or child orientated. How wrong I was!

This is one of the most impressive and immersive things I have ever experienced on my VR. The storey was fantastic the graphics where beutiful on my 2080ti and it was funny and most importantly  fully emmersive. I regret the fact tha this is a very short storey as I loved it so much I wanted just that bit longer from it. 

If in doubt folks just give it a try honestly it really is good and worth the experience.

WitW was one of the best VR games I have played by far. It was simple yet had so much to it. The storyline was amazing and it made me really feel like I was actually there. I hope to see more conent from either this game or games like it!
The story kept me hooked the entire time! It was a good blend of story-telling and simple interactions. Definitely recommended for anyone wanting a good, immersive VR story!

I loved watching my girlfriend play this game, it was truly a masterpiece that brought us both back to when we were young mindless children running around and enjoying life. Thank you devs, for a truly amazing virtual experience.

This game is such an impressive experience. You don't actually do too much, it is more like an interactive story. The story is so well crafted, the art direction is so stunning, the developers found new and interesting ways in approaching VR and I hope new games will build upon these ideas. Definitely one of my favorite experiences on Oculus Rift.

I'm like some dude in his mid 30's - watching some little girl run around doing imagination stuff didn't exactly have me motivated going into this..  But I thought I'd try it out, reviews were good..

If you fully immerse yourself in this (maybe add 3 glasses of wine, and be undistracted) - it's actually pretty awesome, even if you're a VR gaming veteran there are some scenes which are very beautiful / imaginative or clever.

5/5 - would watch more like this
What a charming, and at times, unnerving short story this is.  Beautifully composed and executed.  I loved every second of it!

This is a must have experience. Lucy is very sweet and you instantly want to help her. The experience has some interactivity and mechanisms I’ve never seen before in VR. My daughter and I played this together. She did the first half and I did the second. We both loved it. I can recommend it enough. She said she was a little scared at times, but it isn’t really scary. Mostly just some of the atmosphere can be a bit dark and foreboding. 

Congrats to the developers. This is one of the top VR experiences I’ve ever done and I’m grateful for it.
Must Play VR game

Absolutely delightful little game. More of a storytelling experience than a "game", and is perfectly suited for anyone looking for a short, magical story. Excellent adaptation of Gaiman and McKean's story, with some great VR implementation. Wish I could give these guys money for this. Please make more!
Thank you for making it.

This game was really cool! My only problem was, with my VR I can walk around but I just run into things. I wish there was a way to walk around using my controllers. Other than that it was super fun and cute!

review_title: I love this story-telling game so much.
one_reviews_text:
This game makes me feel a real and new virtual world in front of my eyes. High quality graphic presentation, best sound effects and player interaction.
Thank for making it free.

I really enjoy apps like these, except I am disabled and in a wheelchair. It is far to difficult to try to spin around in my confined area. I tried using my touch controllers to spin so I could c what was going on behind me but they don't work. I am able to grab items, ie: flashlight, camera, crayon, sword, etc. Cannot fire laser back at wolves though or spin. Spinning would b great here! Dear Dev's is it possible to make the touch controllers work on Rift. My rig is Windows 10, 16GB Ram, GTX1070, 256SSD, 1TB HDD. Thanx in advance for the spin, lol.

There are only a few games that I feel are VR masterpieces, and this is one of them. By far, this game is one of my favorite VR games. The environments are beautifully crafted, the characters have unique designs, the game has a wonderfully cartoonish art style, and the animation is amazing. I went into this game knowing nothing about it, and I was completely blown away. I was having fun from start to finish, but it's hard to say anything about the play style without telling people what's in the game. I highly recommend this game, and I recommend this game even more if you know little to nothing about it. Cute, fun, eerie, and a little emotional, somehow all squeezed into the same wonderful package. Absolutely fantastic.
Just wow.
Had installed, no problem, 3 weeks ago. Had not used yet. Update came and then states can not install ???

review_title: a Special VR moment for me
one_reviews_text: This was one of the best VR games I ever played

review_title: One of the best VR stories so far
one_reviews_text: Excellent combination of interaction and storytelling. Highly recommended.
This is the best thing I have experienced in awhile. Creepy and fun about 30mins long just perfect.

A wonderful experience full of detail and spectacle exclusive to the medium of VR. Being an imaginary friend brought joy to my little soul. Thank you so much to Fable for making this game accessible and best of luck in any future projects.
Even after the initial novelty of VR wears of there are experiences like this which completely take your breath away. Inventive, beautiful, well directed and surprisng. This is what VR was made for!

...I knew it must be interesting.  It's a perfekt VR experience, beside the two crashes, each at the beginning of a new chapter. But I don't want to complain about that, 'cause it really is a breathtaking experience. I want more!!!

At first glance i thought this is more a childish game, but... i have to admire, that i got fully immersived in Lucy's World and felt like many others here.
I hope there will be a sequel.
Can recommend!

is incredible how virtual reality leads us to feel things that are not easy to remember, becoming a child and playing with Lucy was an incredible experience, the game is beautiful the VR needs more of these types of games wow!
To think that this is free to play is just crazy I dont know why people is giving it anything less then 4 stars I hope the team makes other great little VR story games like this!

This is a great interactive story. I don't do reviews but this games deserved the time to say what an amzing job they did. Thank you to the team who put this together it was a treat. This is a must experience tittle.

Wolves in the Walls is not a game, nor is it entirely scripted. The interactions are subtle and quite well done. The experience is compelling, forging an emotional connection and taking you through a simple story that is sometimes scary, sometimes brave, and often heartwarming, with a dash of silly and triumph. It will take approximately 30 minutes to complete and there is an intermission point about halfway through.

This game is perfect in  every way, the music fits the tone of the game, the art style is perfect, the story is rich, the characters are very good. You can feel for Lucy, and when it's all over, she stays persistant. This game is one of THE BEST! Play it. You wont regret, but be begging for more. PLAY THIS!!!

review_title: A better story than Nier Automata
one_reviews_text: Nice story, item interactions and overall experience. Borderline scary considering I'm a scardy cat, but thumbs up to the people who made this! And yes, I wanna be your friend :) *scribbles in chalk*

This was an imaginative story, with some well crafted interactions.  The suggested age is 10+, but I can affirm my 10 year old would not want to play this - just a little too eerie of an atmosphere.  Think 'Corraline' type stuff. 

Well done, but who is the target audience?

review_title: A Must Experience for VR Owners
one_reviews_text: I had heard the title of this Story mentioned a few times and likeed what I had heard about it so I downloaded it. What can I say but I absolutely adore this title, its a mixture of fantastic anamation work and storytelling. The latter is to be expected as it was originally written by the great Nick Gaiman! Not overly long in duration but it has you engrossed in the world of Lucy that time here is never important. Yes I would have liked it maybe to be a little longer but I suspect this is just how the story goes. I really look froward to the next installment if there is going to be another one ;) Do yourself a favour and just try this and I am sure you will be just as overjoyed that you did.

just downloaded it today and finished it it is all great and i recommend buying it


if your wondering if this game is scary it isnt so yea



one more thing for dev
pls make more interactive parts i would really enjoy it thank you
If you like Gaiman and/or Tim Burton's older stuff, this is a must-"play". More viewing/enjoying than actual playing, but man, this is good stuff!

I didn't know what to expect, but this was an amazing experience. I felt very connected to Lucy to the point where when she was on the ground, I got to my knees as well. I even put up my arm to protect her from the wolves! Maybe I'm getting overly-connected to the character, but it was still fantastic. I'll be getting my family to play this as soon as possible.

Absolutely superior to anything in VR right now. Even without the abilty to move. Beautiful storytelling, graphics, animation and use of 360 camera with genius transitions. Fluid, slick , premium and hearfelt. Stunning.
One of the best, super cute, and it made me cry :'(

review_title: One of the best vr experiences i've had!
one_reviews_text: I legit felt like i was there with lucy during it all and that were were actually friends in a way. All the subtle details such as the writing on the wall and the cup were done perfectly! You need a bit of a large playspace but can get around it if you don't have too much room! Definitly not just for kids, I feel like all ages would enjoy this. Highly reccomend to any friends you have that haven't tried vr before!

This was a hit with my 8yr old little girl. She finished the whole thing in one go. She was in love with the little girl and the fact that she lived her pig as much as my daughter loves her bunny she has carried since birth. Thanks for the hard work and the great story.
This game is one of the best games i have ever played i wouldve bought this for 10$  and still have been happy
Beautiful story told in unique way. Thank you.
I downloaded this on a whim and was amazed by the incredible storytelling and graphics. This was an amazing game and I would highy recomend it to anyone looking for a good interactive story game.
And for everyone that says "not for kids" I say pah. Maybe not for very young kids, but don't write this off as too scary. Give it a try first and decide for yourself whether they're ready.
Wow, well done guys. One of the most endearing, amazing interactive movies I have been in.  A real work of art.
This is what VR is all about. I felt immersed and entertained the entire time. The sound was incrediable and the graphics kept me on my guard. I can not wait for a sequel. Well done gents!
I loved this. I'm a grumpy old codger who is cynical to the bone, but that kid melted my black lump of a heart. It's free, I highly recommend anyone spend 45 minutes of their life on this.
I cried like a baby. Not even sure why. 😭😭😭

review_title: One of the best VR stories I've played
one_reviews_text: During around 30-40 min, and split into 2 parts, you'll experience a very elaborate story, truly immersive that takes advantage of many VR possibilities, and surrounded by an awesome art style and music. Fantastic work!!

review_title: VR storytelling has come a long way
one_reviews_text: I experienced the earliest VR stories on google cardboard a few years ago. Then experiences on the original rift brought it to a new level. I didn't expect the combination of immersion, beauty and interactivity that this experience would hold . On a Rift S there is almost no screen door effect and the graphics are crisp even on close inspection. The story, and opportunities to interact with the story, pulled me in from the beginning leading up to an exciting finally. Enjoy!

The good:

- hi-rez textures are pretty.
loved this so much

review_title: VR Movie Art for teenagers and adults
one_reviews_text:
Did remind me of the quality of Crow, although Wolves in the Walls probably had a much lower budget. The ability to interact and become part of the story is awesome. This is art and replenishes any faith in VR movies in case needed ;) 

The dark story draws you in, and this VR movie is for teenagers and adults, not young kids. Performance was nice, with some dips in the kitchen. The movie feels poorly optimized, I had asw using super-sampling 2.0 more or less constantly, but it mostly felt like 90 fps or close. But beware: the devs aren't joking recommending a GTX 1080, although it's hard to see why you really need more than GTX 970. No Quest for this movie I guess ;)
Colors and sounds were great, really deep SPUD-free blacks and deep bass (also the voice of her father). Congrats to the devs for a great and remarkable achievement!

This short film was fantastic !  The story, interactions and mystery draw you in !  Even though it was a short film (with interaction), it felt satisfactory lengthy for me.  This reminds me of the movie " Coraline ", with it's dark, scary and mystery elements.  It's not crazy scary, it just has a creepy atmosphere.  Out of the other short films, like Crow, Henry, Lost, Colosse, Invasion and so many other VR films, Wolves in the Walls is my favorite !
VERY GOOD

review_title: Sets a new standard for VR movies
one_reviews_text:
I have enjoyed many short VR films such as Lost, Henry, and Allumette. Wolves in the Walls is, quite simply, head and shoulders above all of them.

Not only is a beautifully stylized work which puts you into a gorgeous storybook world, but the many little moments of interactivity - from getting to draw on the walls to helping brew a magic potion - make you an active participant in the world instead of just a passive observer, and the little girl is a touching, well-voiced character you will absolutely fall in love with. This is the sort of experience VR was invented for. It feels like a new kind of storytelling: half movie, half game, and completely wonderful.

The only drawback is that, being only Chapter 1, the story is naturally unfinished and I am desperate to know what happens next. The remaining chapters cannot come soon enough!

Not going to lie, I thought this was gonna be a boring video/play through but it turned out being amazing. I love how we get to know the characters such as Lucy's mother, father and brother. I was sad that it ended with a cliff hanger but hey, if this game was on sell i'll buy it within a heart beat.
A very cool and immersive short story experience.  It's worth really devoting the time to play this and it's free as well. I wish it was longer and a bit more interactive but it's very good.

Great work! I have waited a long time to watch it. Finally got the chance. It's definitly well made. Love the story and style, and the multiple ways to interact with the character. Hope the final version can be optimized better though, felt my PC (i5+GTX1070) is dropping frame a little bit.

This was so sad as it reminded me of my childhood. About the things that could not exist, such as a secret room under my brothers bed, but I had so much excitement about one day discovering. You really felt like a child, the rooms were warped in a way that makes everything seem like it is twice as long as it actually is. Again, GET THIS, this even beats out Crow the Legend! :D

review_title: One of the most beautiful VR experiences
one_reviews_text:
Honeslty i am amazed that this is free. I would have happily paid a few bucks for it. 

I think this is what the future of entertainment will be. You get all of the vicerial emotions of a real world experience, with the currated art work only a well crafted movie can provide. 

Highly recommened. Amazing work. i'd give it 10 stars if I could.

review_title: One of the best experiences in VR
one_reviews_text:
I had the Oculus Rift for a long time now, I have so many games and by now it doesn't impress me as much as the first few times.
This interactive film has given me one of the most immersive experiences in VR tried so far. Beyond the excellent drafting of the characters and the remarkable quality of the settings, this experience reveals what is, in my opinion, one of the most exceptional audio managements ever tried in my life, in VR and not. An audio so well balanced that, in one situation over all, I had the most intense immersion in VR experienced so far, to the point that my brain was so deceived as to make me really perceive in that place, not only for the images but also for audio, incredibly tuned to really make you feel there! I'm talking about the scene right after we fight with the sword, while the kid plays TV with the strange VR viewer.
Incredible experience! Superb, beautiful, magnificent!

review_title: How storytelling in VR should be
one_reviews_text: I found the story cute and Lucy's world cozy (more so than frightening). I found everything to be very sharp, and the fact that you could interact with things and follow Lucy's commands made me very invested in the story, and made me immediately leave my chair so that I could move around more freely and kneel if I wanted to. However, the story is short, but it is free so I can only appreciate what I got to experience. But I always wish these kind of Vr-stories were longer. I could easily see myself spending 20 euros on a story like this one which would last between one hour and one hour and a half. At least it seems like there will be more chapters, and I can not wait!

This is a fantastic story with beautiful artwork (I especially loved the kitchen!) and top-notch voice acting. I've been waiting for this ever since I read about it being in development and I'm so pleased it's turned out so well. 

After finishing this early access version, I immediately wanted to play through the experience again - not something I've ever had the urge to do with other narrative-driven VR games, even when they've been really good. It's just SO enjoyable and interesting!

Same as Pappakeefy wrote. There is no sound when the girl appears. But before that I hear her draw the flashlight and my eyes. But then after that, there is NO sound.
Edit: This was fixed by installing a update for Windows. 
I really liked this, alltho it was a bit chaotic at times.

Released in January i guess i missed it. There are now several VR animations of great quality many are free. This is yet another gem one of the very best. I tip my hat to the talent that makes these films it can't be the greatest of audience size or a widely recognised artform but the presentation of animation through medium of VR works so well that it will surely become mainsteam & as important a vehicle for stories as movies, audio & books. 
I will not go into details about specifics of this short film only to fully recomend it.

It was like one of those weird dreams you have that you wake up from, only to wonder what the heck it was about. Great sense of scale in some scenes that honestly made me feel like I was inside of a weird childhood memory... Wish it was longer! Really was mindblowing

In 2D games, there was a time when this year's pre-rendered in-game clips would become next year's ingame graphics.

Let's hope that one day in VR, this year's movie becomes next year's gameplay.

I tried things like taking pictures of the NPC, throwing jars at everyone, putting a tail near the NPC's face, and not dropping the blood in the mixture as I was meant to, and two of those four actions did trigger a reaction, althought I'd need a replay to confirm those two reactions weren't simply part of the single default script.

5-stars because it's high quality and free, but it's not a game.

review_title: Lucy Should Have Wolves For Parents
one_reviews_text:
There's clearly something going on that I as an adult picked up on. A year ago something terrible happened, I'm assuming grandma died because all her stuff is in the attic. Well, instead of addressing Lucy's concerns that grandma's diary was right her parents keep reassuring her that there can't be wolves because when they come out of the walls it's all over.

The problem with VR rather than a book is that it's rather hard to stop and explain things like imagination, loss of a loved one, and a child misunderstanding her grandmother's diary. Also, your tiny one will get to fight wolves and see a real wolf attack.

If your child doesn't scare easy and understands the difference between fantasy and reality, great, have at it. But this was clearly a dark kid's book made even more dark and violent for VR. If you haven't covered topics like death, imaginary friends and reality verus fantasy this is hardly the ideal way to start.

Wolves make lovely and nurturing parents btw. They aren't evil nightmare fuel hiding in the walls and they don't dream of eating little kids. If you are going to try this for your little ones keep in mind some positive wolf education.

I went into this game not really knowing what i was in for. Horror? Mystery? Or just something childish. However, i left the experience just feeling shocked. It started out with credits. Yet somehow they found a way to make it unique. The hands looked like they were drawn. 

Please do not scroll down unless you wish to see spoilers. 

When you begin, the first thing you see is Lucy, the little girl drawing your eyes on. It takes just a few seconds to get to the point. The rest of the game felt just as much as a cartoon as it did reality. By the time we got to the end of the day, i was just focused on the amazing artwork. During the breakdown, dear god it got dark. It was beyond impressive. Flashing in and out, the wolves were absolute nightmare fuel. 10/10 experience. Play it as soon as possible.

I've never actually read the book for this game, nor did I even know it was a book, until I played this game. I'm amazed at how great of a story this was, and also how interactive it is to!

This for sure has got to be one of my favorite Experiences I've played, and I look forward to part two!

I love watching VR experiences like this and without a doubt, this is the best I've seen/experienced so far.  The interactivity makes it even more special!
Don't let this one pass you by - a huge thank you to the developers for creating this masterpiece!
I have no sound when the little girl appears, but I do when holding the torch at the start.  Any ideas?
I'll keep it short... it's just an amazing overall experience, nice story, artwork, sound, interaction, simply one of the best interactive movie like experiences so far. What can I say, just try it!
i cant believe that was free, this was one of the best short vr movies i've played.

I've had a Rift now since it launched and there have been some great experiences. However, Wolves in the Walls beats them all!! This is truly amazing and I was sad when it ended. 

This shows exactly how incredible interactive story telling in VR can be. WOW!!
